1.title: Film Festival Directors
1.plot: Fernando A. Mico, C.W. Prather, and Jody Kielbasa share their struggles, successes, and growth as film festival directors.

2.title: Comic Book Conventions: Awesome Con
2.plot: Cosplayers, vendors, and the co-founder of Awesome Con give us a sneak peek into what it's like to attend the biggest comic-book convention in Washington DC.

3.title: Comic Book Conventions: C2E2
3.plot: On this special edition 3 part episode of "Movers and Shakers Unlimited", we highlight Comic Book Conventions: C2E2 (Chicago Comic and Entertainment Expo).

4.title: Comic Book Conventions: San Diego Comic-Con
4.plot: "Movers and Shakers Unlimited" explores the most popular and star-studded comic book convention of all time: San Diego Comic Con.

5.title: Screenwriters
5.plot: "Movers and Shakers Unlimited" has an in depth discussion with screenwriters Anne Marie DiNardo, Jimmy George, and Jamie Nash.

6.title: Movie Exhibitors
6.plot: "Movers and Shakers Unlimited" explores what it takes to operate a movie theater by highlighting movie exhibitors Juliet Main, Greg Godbout, and Hamid Hashemi.

7.title: Film & TV Composers
7.plot: "Movers and Shakers Unlimited" explores the work of Film and TV composers: Brian Wilbur Grundstrom, Charles-Henri Avelange, and Blake Neely.

8.title: Film Producers
8.plot: "Movers and Shakers Unlimited" highlights the careers of film producers: Theodore A Adams III, Scott Selman, and Don Hahn.

9.title: Publicists
9.plot: We sit down with publicists Milinda Jefferson, John Kelly, and Michelle Soudry to discuss how they started, what their job entails, and how to be a great publicist.

10.title: Actors
10.plot: Actors Eric Carpenter, Kenneth De Abrew, and Daphne Maxwell-Reid give us an insight on how they've maneuvered their way as successful performers throughout the entertainment industry.

locations: Silver Spring, Maryland, USA::(AFI Silver Theater)
Washington, District of Columbia, USA::(Angelika Pop-Up at Union Market)
Arlington, Virginia, USA::(Arlington Cinema and Drafthouse)
Brooklyn, New York, USA::(Dazzler Brooklyn Hotel)
North Hollywood, California, USA::(studio) (Cow on the Wall Studios)
San Diego, California, USA::(San Diego Comic-Con)
Boca Raton, Florida, USA::(iPic Theaters Mizner Park)
Bethesda, Maryland, USA::(iPic Theaters Pike and Rose)
imdb.plot outline: A 30 minute TV show that highlights the inspirations, struggles, and successes of entrepreneurs, artists, and innovators. We hear from beginning, emerging, and established people in their respective fields. If it's filmmaking, music, comic books, hospitality, non-profits, food, sports, luxury goods and services, technology, or any other exciting industry, we will have an in-depth conversation with these amazing people to learn about how they started, what struggles they faced, and how they were able to overcome those struggles to become successful. We highlight a specific industry each season, and focus on different areas within that business sector to give the viewer a comprehensive look at what it takes to become a "Mover and Shaker".
